page.title: 18TRANSPORT, THE RAILWAY
page.content: The Neath amd Brecon Railway was created in the eighteen sixties. The first passenger train ran in 1867. The railway company finally became part of the Grest Western in 1922 and British Rail in 1948. The line was finally closed in 1962. Today much of the original track has become incorp- orated into adjacent farm land but there are some short stretches of it which have been little changed apart from the removal of the track. There was a station at Crai, indeed the present hamlet owes it origin almost entirely to the railway for there is only a couple of farms shown on the Crai Parish Tithe Survey maps of 1840 where the cluster of houses, the church and the village hall are now located.
